app.pages package

Submodules

app.pages.Colocalizer module

Dash app for visualization and analysis of microscopy images.

This module provides functionality to: 1. Load and parse .lif microscopy files 2. Display individual channels with customizable colormaps 3. Generate merged views of selected channels 4. Allow synchronized zooming across all views

The app uses Dash callbacks to handle user interactions and update visualizations dynamically.

app.pages.Colocalizer.LinkedZoom(relayout_data, figure_states)[source]

Synchronize zoom/pan across all channel views.

Parameters:

  • relayout_data – List of per-figure relayout dicts.

  • figure_states – List of figure dicts to update.

Returns:

Tuple of (broadcast relayout dicts, updated figures).

app.pages.Colocalizer.generate_figures(image_data)[source]

Generate channel figures and merged view UI.

Parameters:

image_data (list) – List of channel image data arrays.

Returns:

Tuple of (list of channel figure columns, merged view components).

app.pages.Colocalizer.handle_uploaded_data_table(file_contents, file_name, mod_date, current_upload_style)[source]

Handle uploaded microscopy file and update UI elements.

Parameters:

  • file_contents – Base64 encoded file contents.

  • file_name – Name of uploaded file.

  • mod_date – Modification timestamp (epoch seconds).

  • current_upload_style – Current style dict for upload indicator.

Return type:

tuple

Returns:

Tuple of (parsed image data, file info elements, updated style).

app.pages.Colocalizer.load_image(image_data)[source]

Parse a base64-encoded .lif file into nested image arrays.

Parameters:

image_data (str) – Base64-encoded contents of a Leica .lif file.

Returns:

Dict image_name -> timepoint -> z_level -> stacked channel array.

app.pages.Colocalizer.load_image_slice(image_data, name, t, z)[source]

Load a specific image slice based on selected parameters.

Parameters:

  • image_data – Full image dataset.

  • name – Selected image series name.

  • t – Selected timepoint.

  • z – Selected Z-level.

Returns:

Numpy array for the selected slice.

app.pages.Colocalizer.load_merge(image_data, channel_selection, method, channel_cmap, reverse, fig)[source]

Generate merged view of selected channels.

Parameters:

  • image_data (list) – List of channel image data arrays.

  • channel_selection (list) – Two selected channel indices.

  • method (str) – Merge method ('Multiply' or 'Add').

  • channel_cmap (str) – Colormap for merged view.

  • reverse (list) – Whether to reverse the colormap.

  • fig (Figure) – Current figure object.

Returns:

Updated Plotly Figure for the merged view.

app.pages.MS_Inspector module

Dash app for inspection and analysis of MS performance based on TIC graphs.

This module provides a web interface for visualizing and analyzing Mass Spectrometry (MS) performance through Total Ion Current (TIC) graphs and related metrics. It allows users to explore MS runs based on time periods, run IDs, or sample types.

Features:

  • Interactive TIC visualization with animation controls

  • Multiple trace types support (TIC, MSn_unfiltered)

  • Supplementary metrics tracking (AUC, mean intensity, max intensity)

  • Sample type filtering and date range selection

  • Data export functionality in multiple formats (HTML, PNG, PDF, TSV)

Components:

  • Main TIC graph with adjustable opacity for temporal comparison

  • Three supplementary metric graphs (AUC, mean intensity, max intensity)

  • Control panel for MS selection, date ranges, and sample types

  • Animation controls for TIC visualization

  • Data download functionality

Dependencies:

  • dash: Web application framework

  • plotly: Interactive plotting library

  • pandas: Data manipulation and analysis

  • dash_bootstrap_components: Bootstrap components for Dash

app.pages.MS_Inspector.num_of_traces_visible

Maximum number of traces visible at once

Type:

int

app.pages.MS_Inspector.trace_color

RGB color code for traces

Type:

str

app.pages.MS_Inspector.trace_types

List of supported trace types (TIC, MSn_unfiltered)

Type:

list

app.pages.MS_Inspector.run_limit

Maximum number of runs that can be loaded at once

Type:

int

Notes

  • The application enforces a run limit to maintain performance

  • Traces are displayed with decreasing opacity for temporal comparison

  • All graphs are synchronized for consistent data visualization

app.pages.MS_Inspector.delim_runs(runs)[source]

Parse a string of run IDs into a sorted list of identifiers.

Parameters:

runs – String containing run IDs separated by whitespace or , ; :.

Returns:

Sorted list of run IDs (strings).

Returns:

app.pages.MS_Inspector.download_graphs(n_clicks, tic_fig, auc_fig, mean_fig, max_fig, plot_data, parameters)[source]

Create a ZIP with current graphs and data for download.

Parameters:

  • n_clicks – Number of clicks on download button.

  • tic_fig – TIC plot figure.

  • auc_fig – AUC plot figure.

  • mean_fig – Mean intensity plot figure.

  • max_fig – Max intensity plot figure.

  • plot_data – Underlying data (pandas split-JSON).

Returns:

send_bytes payload of the ZIP, or no_update if not triggered.

app.pages.MS_Inspector.update_run_choices(_, selected_ms, start_date, end_date, data_types, run_id_list, button_text, num_of_traces_visible, trace_color, required_maincols, run_limit, trace_types, database_file)[source]

Update the list of runs based on selected criteria. :type selected_ms: :param selected_ms: Selected MS. :type start_date: :param start_date: Start date. :type end_date: :param end_date: End date. :type data_types: :param data_types: Selected data types. :type run_id_list: :param run_id_list: Optional string of run IDs to load. :type button_text: :param button_text: Current button text. :type num_of_traces_visible: int :param num_of_traces_visible: Number of traces visible. :type required_maincols: list :param required_maincols: Required main columns. :type run_limit: int :param run_limit: Run limit. :type trace_types: list :param trace_types: Selected trace types. :type database_file: str :param database_file: Database file. :rtype: tuple :returns: Tuple of (chosen_tics, trace_dict, plot_data, max_y, button_text, button_clicks).

app.pages.MS_Inspector.update_tic_graph(_, __, ___, ____, tic_index, ticlist, datatype, supp_datatype, traces, plot_data, max_y, num_of_traces_visible, trace_color)[source]

Update the TIC and supplementary metric graphs.

Parameters:

  • tic_index (int) – Current TIC index.

  • ticlist (list) – List of TIC internal run IDs.

  • datatype (str) – Trace type to display (e.g., 'TIC' or 'MSn').

  • supp_datatype (str) – Trace type for supplementary plots.

  • traces (dict) – Dict mapping run id -> trace dicts.

  • plot_data (str) – Plot data (pandas split-JSON).

  • max_y (dict) – Dict of maximum y-values per trace type.

  • num_of_traces_visible (int) – Number of traces visible.

  • trace_color (str) – Trace color.

Return type:

tuple

Returns:

Tuple of (tic fig, auc fig, mean fig, max fig, next index).

app.pages.QC_and_data_analysis module

Restructured frontend for proteogyver app.

This module contains the main frontend logic for the Proteogyver application, including callbacks for data processing, analysis, and visualization.

app.pages.QC_and_data_analysis.parameters

Application parameters loaded from parameters.toml

Type:

dict

app.pages.QC_and_data_analysis.db_file

Path to the database file

Type:

str

app.pages.QC_and_data_analysis.contaminant_list

List of contaminant proteins

Type:

list

app.pages.QC_and_data_analysis.figure_output_formats

Supported figure export formats

Type:

list

app.pages.QC_and_data_analysis.layout

Main application layout

Type:

html.Div

  • chosen_samples (List[str]) – Sample names selected for discarding.

Return type:

Union[List[str], Any]

Returns:

Updated list of discarded samples, or no_update if not triggered.

app.pages.QC_and_data_analysis.check_inputs(*args)[source]

Validate that all required inputs are present before analysis.

Returns True if inputs are invalid, to directly control the disabled state of the “Begin analysis” button.

Parameters:

args (Any) – Data table info, sample table info, selected workflow, selected figure theme, and upload success styles.

Return type:

bool

Returns:

True if inputs are invalid, False if valid.

  • rescue (List[str]) – Selected rescue options.

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

Returns:

Filtered SAINT results.

app.pages.QC_and_data_analysis.proteomics_volcano_plots(imputed_data, control_group, comparison_data, comparison_upload_success_style, data_dictionary, fc_thr, p_thr, test_type)[source]

Create volcano plots for proteomics differential abundance analysis.

Parameters:

  • imputed_data (Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) – Imputed proteomics data for analysis.

  • control_group (Optional[str]) – Selected control group name for control-based comparisons.

  • comparison_data (Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) – Comparison table data for custom comparisons.

  • comparison_upload_success_style (Dict[str, str]) – Style indicating comparison table validation status.

  • data_dictionary (Dict[str, Any]) – Main data dictionary with sample information.

  • fc_thr (float) – Fold-change threshold for significance.

  • p_thr (float) – P-value threshold for significance.

  • test_type (str) – Statistical test type to use.

Return type:

Union[Tuple[Div, Dict[str, Any], str], Any]

Returns:

Tuple of (volcano plot components, differential data, completion notifier) or no_update on invalid input.
